pdf.intro: This material contains activities organized by level: beginner, intermediate, and advanced. They can be carried out at home or in the classroom using simple resources.
pdf.intro_instructions: This page contains instructions for assembling the games.

sections.beginner_content: Activities focused on literacy and first contact with words.

beginner_games.title: Memory Game – Image and Word
beginner_games.summary: Match images to their corresponding words.
instructions: Print cards with images and their corresponding words.
Shuffle the cards and place them face down on the table.
Players take turns flipping two cards to find a match.
The player with the most pairs at the end wins.

beginner_games.title: Alphabet Bingo
beginner_games.summary: Recognize alphabet letters through the game.
instructions: Prepare bingo cards with letters of the alphabet.
The teacher or facilitator draws letters from a bag and announces them out loud.
Players mark the corresponding letter on their card.
The first to complete a line or the whole card wins.

beginner_games.title: Object Hunt
beginner_games.summary: Identify objects from written or spoken clues.
instructions: Write simple object names (e.g., ball, chair, spoon).
Say the word or show the written card.
Children must find the object in the environment.
The first to bring the correct object scores a point.

sections.intermediate_content: Activities to expand vocabulary and form simple sentences.

intermediate_games.title: Word Domino
instructions: Create domino pieces with a syllable on one side and the rest of the word on the other.
Distribute the pieces among players.
Players take turns placing pieces to form correct words.
The first to use all their pieces wins.

intermediate_games.title: Hangman (adapted)
intermediate_games.summary: Guess the secret word by suggesting letters.
instructions: Choose a simple word and draw blank spaces on paper.
Players suggest letters one at a time.
For each mistake, draw part of the figure (e.g., a stick figure).
The goal is to guess the word before completing the drawing.

intermediate_games.title: Sentence Building
intermediate_games.summary: Form simple sentences using word cards.
instructions: Prepare cards with nouns, verbs, and adjectives.
Distribute the cards among players.
Players take turns forming short sentences using at least 3 cards.
The group votes for the funniest or most creative sentence.

sections.advanced_content: Activities for text comprehension, logical reasoning, and storytelling.

advanced_games.title: Story Continuation
advanced_games.summary: Create a collaborative story by adding sentences in turns.
instructions: The first player starts with a sentence (e.g., 'Once upon a time, there was a child who loved adventures').
Each player continues the story with a new sentence.
The story continues until everyone agrees to end it.
At the end, read the whole story out loud.

advanced_games.title: Word Search
advanced_games.summary: Find hidden words in a grid of letters.
instructions: Prepare a word search grid with words from a specific theme (e.g., animals, fruits, school).
Distribute the grids to players.
Players must find and circle all the listed words.
The first to find them all wins.

advanced_games.title: Fun Debate
advanced_games.summary: Practice argumentation and reasoning through debates.
instructions: Divide players into two groups.
Choose a simple theme (e.g., 'Books are better than TV').
Each group prepares 2–3 arguments.
Groups take turns presenting arguments, and the audience decides the winner.

cards.title: School and Learning
phrases: It’s better to study in the morning than in the afternoon.
Reading books is more fun than watching cartoons.
Homework should be shorter.
It’s better to write with a pencil than with a pen.
It’s better to study in silence than with music.

cards.title: Home and Family
phrases: Sleeping early is better than sleeping late.
Helping at home is fun.
It’s better to play alone than with friends.
Dogs are better pets than cats.
It’s nicer to eat with family than alone.

cards.title: Games and Fun
phrases: It’s more fun to play outdoors than indoors.
Board games are better than video games.
Jumping rope is more fun than playing ball.
It’s better to play in the park than in the yard.
Drawing is more fun than painting.

cards.title: Food
phrases: Ice cream is better than cake.
Fruit is tastier than candy.
Soda is better than juice.
Lunch is nicer than dinner.
Pizza is better than hamburgers.

cards.title: Everyday Life and Imagination
phrases: It’s better to live in the countryside than in the city.
Superheroes are cooler than princesses.
Riding a bike is better than riding a car.
Going to the beach is more fun than going to the mall.
Traveling is better than staying at home.
